results.title: Molly & Moborak = Molly and Moborak [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Jotz Productions and Tom Zubrycki
results.brief_description: This moving, understated work focuses on the mixed fortunes of an Afghanistan refugee, Mobarak Tahiri, who finds work and an adopted family in the small town of Young, New South Wales. Along with many of his fellow refugees, Mobarak works in the local abattoir, receiving praise for their work ethic. Local community members show great support for the refugees - organising English lessons, soccer matches and outings. But despite this goodwill, at times the town seethes with racial hatred and bigotry. Set against the backdrop of Prime Minister John Howard’s hard-line stance on asylum seekers, “Molly & Mobarak” depicts friendship, kindness, romance and tolerance. Veteran Australian filmmaker Tom Zubrycki’s sympathies clearly lie with the asylum seekers, but this does not prevent the work from being intelligent and thought provoking.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Jotz Productions and Tom Zubrycki

results.title: Molly
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, Hilary Linstead and Ned Lander
results.brief_description: Molly is a dog with a special gift- she can sing. This results in fortune and misfortune as it attracts love to the good but noticeable attention to bad fortune hunters. Travelling with her owner (Reg Lye) from the outback to the city brings its fair share of adventures. A modern Australian fairy tale that will delight viewers. Starring Melissa Jaffer, Reg Lye, Garry McDonald, Claudia Carvan and Members of the Flying Fruit Fly Circus.

results.title: Mollusks: the mussels - respiration and digestion
results.brief_description: Shows the systemic biology of mollusks. Illustrates exactly how the structure of the mollusk is related to its functions.

results.title: Moliere
results.creator_credit: Triangle Productions, Norbert Tildian and Elvire Chessin
results.brief_description: The world and environment of Moliere portrayed in 17th century drawings and paintings. His satirical comedies “Tartuffe”, “Les Ecole des Femmes”, “L’Avarre” and “Le Bourgeois Gentilhomme” are discussed. Several scenes from the plays, spoken in French, are incorporated. The actors are from La Comedie Francaise. Main commentary in English.

results.title: Molecules and life
results.creator_credit: Anvil Films, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Peter De Normanville
results.brief_description: Outlines achievements in molecular biology which have revolutionised our understanding of the chemical and physical basis of life. Includes the structure of large organic molecules such as insulin, haemoglobin, myoglobin and vitamin B12, the joining together of amino acids, the complexity of proteins, x-ray crystallography, and clinical applications of scientists’ work.

results.title: Molds and how they grow
results.brief_description: Laboratory demonstrations show the effects of moisture and temperature on the growth of moulds. Photomicrography reveals the structure of moulds hyphae, mycelium, sporeballs, spores. Beginning with spores on a rice culture, timelapse photography shows the formation of a new colony.

results.title: Mojo working: Jimi Hendrix 1942-1970
results.creator_credit: Gravity, Initial (GB), Screen Ventures, Christopher Mould, Alan Douglas and Mark Neale
results.brief_description: Part of the television documentary series “The Making of modern music”. Features live performance footage of Jimi Hendrix and personal commentary by various musicians, writers and critics in the music industry including Keith Le Blanc, Jaz Coleman, P.P. Arnold, Afrika Bambaata, Melanie Williams, John “Rhino” Edwards (Status Quo) and others. Songs include Purple haze, Johnny B Goode, Red house, The Wind cries Mary, Voodoo Chile, Wild thing. “Mojo working” is made up edited excerpts from original films by D.A. Pennebaker, Peter Neal, Peter Pilafian, Jean Peller/John Seay.

results.title: Moi universiteti = My universities
results.brief_description:
In the third part of Donskoi’s Gorky trilogy Alexei (Gorky) as a young man struggles to survive in the city of Kazan first as a stevedore and then as a labourer in a bakery where he cannot accept the simple fact of exploiter and exploited. Alexei experiences a crisis in his life from which he emerges with greater maturity. Also available on 16mm. Part 1 (The Childhood of Maxim Gorki) and Part 2 (My Apprenticeship) of the trilogy available on 16mm, 35mm and VHS. ‘The Gorky Trilogy’ is also available as one title on VHS.

Credits: Director, writer, Mark Donskoi ; photography, Piotr Ermolov ; music, Lev Schwartz.
Cast: N. Valbert, S. Kayukov.
